newsitem.title: GERMANY: SAP pressured by insider probe news.
newsitem.headline: SAP pressured by insider probe news.

text.p: Shares in German software manufacturer SAP AG fell on Monday against the market trend after prosecutors said they were probing a potentially serious case of insider trading involving SAP stock.
SAP's preferred stock, which is listed on the blue chip DAX index, was down almost four percent at 315.00 marks at 0740 GMT, amid what dealers said was concern about the insider investigation.
The IBIS DAX index, which monitors electronic trade in DAX shares, was up around one percent at 3,524.92 points.

The scale of the insider probe and those affected by it was unclear early on Monday. The daily Handelsblatt newspaper said the probe was targeting management board members but prosecutors declined to give any such details.
"This (the story) is mainly a negative from a sentiment point of view," said a Frankfurt dealer. "It makes no difference to fundamentals."
